caffeine.name: Caffeine
caffeine.pros: Often seen in eye creams and serums; can counteract dark circles and puffiness; alleviates symptoms of fatigue and stress
caffeine.cons: Not enough scientific evidence to back up its effectiveness

coq10.name: COENZYME Q10 (UBIQUINONE)
coq10.pros: Very effective antioxidant commonly seen in supplements and anti-aging topical products; preserves skin-cell function and improves skin texture
coq10.cons: May lower blood sugar levels and blood pressure; high dosage might affect liver enzyme levels

greenteaextract.name: Green Tea Extract
greenteaextract.pros: Can reduce sun damage, sagging skin and wrinkles; safe and mild
greenteaextract.cons: High dosage might cause liver damage

bha.name: BETA HYDROXY ACID (BHA)
bha.pros: Great exfoliant, penetrates deeply into pores, less irritation than AHAs
bha.cons: May increase skin sensitivity to sun exposure

benzoylperoxide.name: BENZOYL PEROXIDE
benzoylperoxide.cons: Dries and peels the skin, can cause allergic reaction

retinol.name: RETINOL (or Retinoids)
retinol.pros: Increases collagen production, fades dark spots from sun damage, tretinoin can treat acne
retinol.cons: cannot be used during day time, makes skin extremely sensitive to sun exposure, can cause peeling

salicylicacid.name: SALICYLIC ACID
salicylicacid.pros: Removes excessive oil and dead skin cells, great exfoliant
salicylicacid.cons: Does not work very well on cystic acne, cannot be used on really dry skin or during pregnancy
